messages.title: The Lib Dem plan for 20,000 more teachers
For the first class local MP our area deserves, local people say...
messages.content: IT'S GOT TO BE WILL FOR Woking

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will Forster vows to fight to stop Brexit and is passionate about staying in the EU, highlighting the impact on NHS, schools, and funding if Brexit happens.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Boris Johnson, Conservative Party; Farage & Brexit Party back Woking Tories
mentions.tacticalSituation: The election in Woking is a two-horse race between the Liberal Democrats and the Conservatives. Winning strategic voters from Labour, Green and Conservative.

issues.brexitEurope: Vows to stop Brexit, emphasizing the negative effects it's already had on Britain's economy and reputation.
issues.education: 20,000 more teachers plan indicates a concern for education; stopping Brexit will protect schools from funding cuts.
issues.health: Stopping Brexit to protect the NHS from the implications of Brexit.

politicalExperience.role: Local Councillor, Mayor and local person to represent Woking

endorsements.endorsement: Recommends voting for the Liberal Democrats candidate in Woking.

quotes.text: Farage & Brexit Party back Woking Tories

images.caption: Will Forster with supporters holding 'Stop Brexit' signs.
Graph showing voting percentages with Lib Dem at 36%, Brexit Party at 28%, and others.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet emphasizes Will Forster as the viable candidate to represent the Remain majority of Woking and stop Brexit. It suggests voting Lib Dem is the strategic choice to prevent a Conservative victory.
